heading: grubstake grill
subheading: meatspace buckets of popcorn, a peanut-strewn floor, and vcs as likely to carve their names in the tables as cut a deal. such is the lore of the dutch goose, a silicon valley dive bar with an upscale clientele. the goose has the full complement of stanford faculty and students, tech-industry bigwigs like intuit chair […]
author: patricia krueger
text: meatspacebuckets of popcorn, a peanut-strewn floor, and vcs as likely to carve their names in the tables as cut a deal. such is the lore of the dutch goose, a silicon valley dive bar with an upscale clientele. the goose has the full complement of stanford faculty and students, tech-industry bigwigs like intuit chair bill campbell and the institute for the future's paul saffo, and jock-geeks from hp - all turning sauce time into a powerful networking opportunity. "you see all types here," says tom moroney, owner of the venerable bar, where patrons can get a meal and a game of pool for five bucks. "mercedes-benz and fur coats, blue jeans and painters." what do they eat? burgers, chicken sandwiches, and spicy deviled eggs. what are they drinking? beer, beer, and, natch, beer.the dutch goose: 3567 alameda de las pulgas, menlo park, california. +1 (650) 854 3245.must readsputterniktired/wiredgood dealas the well turnsall's well that ends wellsmarter bombbattlefield of tomorrowpass it onfashion policewhy buy retail?paranoia technologytailor-made medspeoplejargon watchpersonality typingcustomize or diesailing the red skiesgrubstake grillt1, good buddyraw data
